options.content: Maintains records daily and accurately
Inconsistently maintain records during and between sessions
Does not maintain records during the session or does so but not accurately,
Maintains confidentiality in verbal communication and with learner records
Maintains confidentially of only records, or only during verbal communication
Does not maintain Confidentiality
Adapts to changes in the routine with no or little reminder/explanation. Supports the students in adapting to a change.
Needs multiple reminders to support and adapt to changes in the routine
Does not adapt to changes in routines. Is disruptive to the environment.
Dresses modestly in clean clothes in good repair, & consistent with that of the other professionals in the environment.
Dress not consistent with that of the other professionals in the environment
Dress and/or hygiene is disruptive to the environment
Accepts feedback, acknowledges need for improvement, asks for clarification, and immediately implements recommended changes
Accepts feedback, does not seek clarification, or is delayed in implementing recommended changes
Does not accept feedback, or does not make recommended changes.
Arrives on time and prepared for the session. Notifies provider of any absences.
Attendance: Arrives on time but unprepared
Attendance: Arrives late and unprepared, and/or does not notify cooperating teacher of absences
Exhibits positive and respectful attitude toward providers, families, and other professionals in the environment in verbal and nonverbal communication
Inconsistently exhibits a positive and respectful attitude in verbal or nonverbal communication or across individuals
Uses terms or labels that are disrespectful to individuals, nonverbal communication is disrespectful to individuals in the environment
Takes initiative to improve teaching skills independently and demonstrate this skill across activities
Takes initiative to improve teaching skills only after direction from the teacher, or does not demonstrate across activities
Does not seek opportunities or experiences that with improve teaching skills in the environment
Supports learners appropriately during transitions (between or within activities) using appropriate signals and prompts
Supports learners only during some transitions (between or within activities) or provides to much/inappropriate prompts
Does not support learners, is disruptive, or impedes learner completing transitions independently
Instructor uses all class time efficiently, sufficient opportunities to respond identified and implemented
Instructor uses most of class time efficiently, some opportunities to respond identified and implemented.
Instructor makes inefficient use of time and/or time lost on non-instructional activities
Learners are engaged with materials, peers, or instructor or instructor is using effective strategies to increase engagement
Learners demonstrate low engagement, learner engagement is interrupted by the instructors actions
Learners are not engaged with the materials or activity and there is no effort by the instructor to increase engagement
Assists in gathering materials, arranging, or cleaning up the learning environment throughout the session.
Inconsistently assists in gathering materials, arranging or cleaning up the learning environment through out the session.
Does not assist in arranging or cleaning up the learning environment
Provides sufficient rate of reinforcement for appropriate behavior, reinforcement is matched to the learner
Provides low rates of reinforcement for appropriate behavior, or reinforcement is not matched to the learner
Does not provide reinforcement for appropriate behavior
Follows classroom/individual management plan, Responds to problem behavior consistent with positive approaches
Some but not all problem behaviors addressed using classroom behavior management plan
Does not consistently/effectively follow classroom behavior management plan when learner engages in problem behavior
Communicates with all individuals in the environment to coordinate, support and implement instruction. Voice tone is the appropriate volume, natural, and enthusiastic.
Communicates with only some individuals in the classroom. Voice tone is sometimes the appropriate volume.
Does not communicate with other professionals, or is disruptive to the learning environment
Initiates interactions with learners appropriate for the activity; learning opportunities match the instructional arrangement
Instruction provided sometimes interferes with the ongoing activities of the environment
Does not prepare the learning environment
Gains eye contact from learners, scans across learners in a group, increases and decreases proximity to learner appropriately.
Sometimes gains eye contact from learners, infrequently scans across learners, does not always have appropriately proximity
Does not gain eye contact from learners, infrequently scans across learners, does not have appropriately proximity
Consistently follows correction procedure ending in an independent correct response (Prompt, lead, test, retest); corrects all error
Corrects most errors and/or follows only part of the correction procedure
Errors are not corrected and/or do not follow correction procedure, does not end in independent correct response
Provides clear and consistent cues, directions, instructions, and questions that are developmentally appropriate
Cues, questions, directions, and instructions not always developmentally appropriate
Does not provide clear or consistent cues, directions, instructions, or questions
Uses an appropriate schedule of reinforcement; delivered immediate, contingent, specific.
Provides feedback but the schedule of reinforcement not appropriate for the learner, feedback is mostly general in nature. Feedback delayed
No or little feedback for correct responding
